alert.note: Alert for Martin (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 05 at 5:36PM CDT until July 05 at 6:30PM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Twin Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Martin County in south central Minnesota... * Until 630 PM CDT. * At 535 PM CDT, a line of severe thunderstorms were located 6 miles southwest of Sherburn, or 8 miles east of Jackson In Jackson County, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Law enforcement. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fairmont, Sherburn, Truman, Trimont, Welcome, Ceylon, Iowa Lake, Okamanpedan Lake, Granada, East Chain, Northrop and Dunnell. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
